rationale: The agent's solution wraps assertAsyncSearchHitCount calls in assertBusy, which partially addresses the intermittent failure issue, but introduces several problems: (1) It adds assertBusy wrappers in many unrelated places (indexVersion checks, migration requests) that were not part of the task or ground truth, creating unnecessary complexity. (2) The agent wraps the entire assertAsyncSearchHitCount method in assertBusy AND wraps callers in assertBusy, creating double-retry logic that is redundant and inefficient. (3) The ground truth enhanced assertAsyncSearchHitCount with important state checks (is_running, is_partial) and better error messages that the agent completely missed. (4) The agent added an import statement that may be unnecessary if assertBusy is already available. (5) The agent added extensive retry logic to searchAsyncAndStoreId that was not in the ground truth and changes the method signature unnecessarily. (6) Multiple wrapping of IOException in AssertionError is verbose and not idiomatic to the existing codebase patterns. The core issue (wrapping the three assertAsyncSearchHitCount calls at lines 67, 103, 117) is addressed but in a less robust way than ground truth, and with significant over-engineering elsewhere.
